DOC.brief_title: Study Assess Safety Effects Autologous Adipose-Derived Stromal Cells Delivered Patients With Renal Failure
DOC.detailed_description: Adipose-Derived Stromal Cells ( ASCs ) novel therapy patient suffer Renal failure . By inject ASCs , region may become populated ASCs , thereby potentially restore kidney function . ASCs patient-derived ( `` autologous '' ) cell transplantation technology deliver patient . The therapy compose cell derive patient ' adipose tissue isolate within approximately 1 hour immediately deliver back patient .
DOC.criteria: Males Females Age 18 80 year . Chronic Kidney Disease ( CKD ) patient stage III , IV , V Patient afebrile 24 hour prior procedure . Up date age gender appropriate cancer screen per American Cancer Society . Acute Renal Failure Severe comorbidities like cardiac insufficiency , congestive cardiac failure , malignancy , infection , sepsis bed sore . Hemoglobin level 6g/dl discretion physician depend patient 's overall condition . Chronic kidney disease due autoimmune aetiology , connective tissue disease , amyloidosis storage disorder . Females pregnant nursing female childbearing potential unwilling maintain contraceptive therapy duration study Life expectancy < 6 month due concomitant illness . Exposure investigational drug procedure within 1 month prior study entry enrol concurrent study may confound result study . Active infectious disease .
